intro: Leontodon stenocalathius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawk's-beard, is a perennial herb native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry meadows, grasslands, and rocky soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a rough texture, and its yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a characteristic species of open, sunny environments.
